Namespace Snowflake.Framework.Remoting.GraphQL.Attributes

Classes

ConnectionAttribute

A Connection is a common idiom in GraphQL that implements cursor-based pagination for enumerable objects. Methods marked with ConnectionAttribute must return System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<T>. if the returned System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<T> is impure, cursors may become potentialy meaningless, since nothing is cached between calls of the same method.

A method can only be marked with one of ConnectionAttribute, QueryAttribute, or MutationAttribute, never more than one.

MutationAttribute

A mutation field in this context is simply a normal field on the mutation root object. By convention, only fields in the mutation root object may mutate state, as compared to QueryAttribute, which will attach the method as a field on the query root object instead.

A method can only be marked with one of ConnectionAttribute, QueryAttribute, or MutationAttribute, never more than one.

ParameterAttribute

Describes a parameter in a method's argument list, providing necesssary details about a given parameter so that it may be called from GraphQL.

QueryAttribute

A GraphQL field query in this context is specifically a field on the query root object. This attribute will mark a method as being a GraphQL field on the query root object, and thus makes a method available to the GraphQL query schema.

A method can only be marked with one of ConnectionAttribute, QueryAttribute, or MutationAttribute, never more than one.
